effect.name: GPS Graphic
effect.description: Overlay GPS-related graphics onto the video.
effect.author: Daniel F

parameter.name: resource
GPS File
parameter.comment: The fullpath of file containing location (GPS) data. Supported extensions: .gpx, .tcx.

parameter.name: time_offset
Time offset in seconds
parameter.comment:
An offset (in seconds) to be added to the video file to match it to the GPS track.
Most of the time this will at least need to be set to the timezone difference between the 2 files plus some seconds if the video recording device isn't precisely set to correct time. GPS time is always exact and in UTC. Use positive values if GPS is ahead of video and negative otherwise.

parameter.name: smoothing_value
Smoothing level
parameter.comment:
How many GPS points to smooth in order to eliminate GPS errors.
A value of 1 does not smooth locations, it only calculates the extra fields (speed, distance, etc), it also interpolates missing values for heart rate and altitude.

parameter.name: speed_multiplier
Speed multiplier
parameter.comment:
If the video file is a timelapse (or slow motion), use this value to set the speed up/slow down ratio.
Sample values: 30 for 30x timelapse, 0.25 for 4x slow motion footage.

parameter.name: graph_data_source
Graph data source
parameter.comment: What data from the GPS file is used for drawing

parameter.name: graph_type
Graph type
parameter.comment:
Speedometer is available for all data sources but recommended only for speed; for the map type it represents the "percentage done" from trimmed start - end).
Note: for type 1 (zoom and center, aka "follow the dot"):
* crop values are only valid as a percentage and only the bottom (resp left) values will be taken into consideration as both values (ie: bottom/top) will need to be equal to keep the dot centered)
* if data source is not GPS location, the centering will only be done for horizontal axis (time), vertical axis crop will behave just like for the basic 2D map line (it will statically keep the same min/max limit allowing the Now dot to move up and down).
parameter.paramlistdisplay: Basic 2D map line (for location) or 1D graph per time (others),Zoom in onto the map/graph centered on current location,Draw speedometer

parameter.name: trim_start_p
Trim start (%)
parameter.comment:
Trim data from the start of the GPS file (as a percentage of total).
Note: both Trim start and Trim end are computed from the total file, so trimming 50% start and 50% end will result in trimming the entire file.

parameter.name: trim_end_p
Trim end (%)
parameter.comment:
Trim data from the end of the gps file (as a percentage of total).
Note: both Trim start and Trim end are computed from the total file, so trimming 50% start and 50% end will result in trimming the entire file.

parameter.name: crop_mode_h
Crop mode horizontal
parameter.comment:
Decides how to interpret the Crop left and Crop right values.
Note: for the horizontal type, absolute values are the longitude (for the location source type) and time (in milliseconds since epoch) for the rest of the data source types)

parameter.name: crop_left_p
Crop left
parameter.comment:
Crops data from the left side of the graph (effectively zooming in).
The value is interpreted either as a percentage of total or an absolute value depending on crop_mode_h. In percentage mode, the values are not restricted to 0-100 to allow for "zoom out" behaviour (ie: cropping -50 left will add an extra half of the total horizontal distance). Values over 100 (in % mode) will effectively not display anything. If Graph Type is set to Speedometer, all crop left/right values are ignored.

parameter.name: crop_right_p
Crop right
parameter.comment: Same as Crop left but for the right side, and percentage type is interpreted as an inverse percentage (ie: 100 = do not crop anything). Values under 0 will effectively not display anything.

parameter.name: crop_mode_v
Crop mode vertical
parameter.comment:
Decides how to interpret the Crop bottom and Crop top values.
With an absolute value, it can zoom in to between 100 and 150m of altitude to show small changes in altitude between those 2 values better.
Note: for the vertical type, absolute values are latitude degrees (for the location source type) and altitude, heart rate, speed for the others interpreted as the Legend unit type where applicable (ie: a value of 10 for altitude will be considered meters by default but if changing Legend unit to feet it will mean 10 feet).

parameter.name: crop_bot_p
Crop bottom
parameter.comment:
Crops data from the bottom side of the graph (effectively zooming in).
The value is interpreted either as a percentage of total or an absolute value depending on crop_mode_v. In percentage mode the values are not restricted to 0-100 to allow for "zoom out" behaviour (ie: cropping -50 bot will add an extra half of the total vertical distance to the bottom). Values over 100 (in % mode) will effectively not display anything. If Graph type is Speedometer, this will set the minimum needle position which will clamp all values that are lower.

parameter.name: crop_top_p
Crop top
parameter.comment:
Same as Crop bottom but for the top side, and percentage type is interpreted as an inverse percentage (ie: 100 = do not crop anything).
Values under 0 will effectively not display anything.

parameter.name: color_style
Graph color style
parameter.comment: See the documentation about the various styles available
parameter.paramlistdisplay: One color,Two colors,Solid past - thin future,Solid future - thin past,Vertical gradient,Horizontal gradient,Color by duration,Color by altitude,Color by heart rate,Color by Speed,Color by Speed (max 100km/h),Color by grade (max 90 degrees),Color by grade (max 20 degrees)

parameter.name: color.1
Color 1
parameter.comment: Sets the color #1 for the graph line

parameter.name: color.2
Color 2
parameter.comment: Sets the color #2 for the graph line

parameter.name: color.3
Color 3
parameter.comment: Sets the color #3 for the graph line

parameter.name: color.4
Color 4
parameter.comment: Sets the color #4 for the graph line

parameter.name: color.5
Color 5
parameter.comment: Sets the color #5 for the graph line

parameter.name: show_now_dot
Show Now dot
parameter.comment:
Enable it to draw a disc at the current location/time over the graph line.
If graph type is speedometer, this affects the needle.

parameter.name: now_dot_color
Now dot color
parameter.comment: Sets the color for the Now dot

parameter.name: show_now_text
Show Now text
parameter.comment:
Enable it to draw the current value in big white bold letters on the bottom right side of the rect.
The Legend unit value will be appended at the end and it will be used as the current unit (if a valid unit is found ie: kilometers if "km" is found anywhere in the Legend unit string).

parameter.name: angle
Rotation
parameter.comment: Rotate the entire graph rectangle. For speedometer type the text stays horizontal.

parameter.name: thickness
Line Thickness (px)
parameter.comment: Sets the thickness of the line graph in pixels.

parameter.name: show_grid
Draw legend
parameter.comment:
If enabled it will draw 5 horizontal (and vertical for map type)
lines with small values each corresponding to the current data source value at 0%, 25%, 50%, 75% and 100% of current graph shown, affected by the Legend unit type if applicable, and with the string appended to the value. For speedometer type this shows division values (but without appending unit).

parameter.name: legend_unit
Legend unit
parameter.comment:
Sets the unit to be used for displaying values of type altitude and speed.
Default is meters and km/h respectively. The unit is matched anywhere in the string so extra spaces can be used to tweak displaying.
parameter.paramlistdisplay: m,meter,km,kilometer,mi,mile,ft,feet,nm,nautical,ms,m/s,meter per sec,km,km/h,kilometer per hr,mi,mi/h,mile per hr,ft,ft/s,feet per sec,kn,nm/h,knots,mmin,m/min,ftmin,ft/min

parameter.name: draw_individual_dots
Show dots only
parameter.comment:
If enabled, the graph will be drawn using individual dots instead of lines.
This will effectively show the individual data points as affected by smoothing (ie: for location data it will display each GPS fix if smoothing is 1) and can either be used as a cool effect when zoomed in enough or to debug unexpected line jumps.

parameter.name: rect
Graph rectangle
parameter.comment:
Defines the rectangle that the graph should be drawn in.
Format is: "X Y W H". X, Y, W, H are assumed to be pixel units unless they have the suffix '%'.

parameter.name: bg_img_path
Background image
parameter.comment:
If a valid image file is selected, it will be used as a background for the rectangle area.
Paths starting with the "!" character are ignored. TIP: use a map image to add context to the GPS track.

parameter.name: bg_scale_w
Background scale
parameter.comment:
Scale the background image (relative to center) to match it to the above GPS track.
Values smaller than 100 zoom into the image, values larger than 100 zoom out. 0 hides it.

parameter.name: bg_opacity
Background opacity
parameter.comment: Sets the opacity for the background image

parameter.name: gps_start_text
GPS start time
parameter.comment: Date and time of the first valid GPS point.

parameter.name: video_start_text
Video start time
parameter.comment: Date and time of the video file.

parameter.name: auto_gps_offset_start
Auto offset start
parameter.comment: Provides a helper offset to guarantee start of video file syncs with the start of GPS file. Correctly sets the offset if video file and GPS recording was started at the same time.

parameter.name: auto_gps_offset_now
Auto offset now
parameter.comment: Provides a helper offset to sync the first GPS point to current video time (it is updated every second). Correctly sets the offset if your video record the moment GPS starts.

parameter.name: map_coords_hint
Map hint
parameter.comment: Returns the middle latitude and longitude coordinates of the gps file.
